pages.text: Once upon a time, a man lived in a small hut by the sea. He had a wife. They had very little. Each day, the man would fish. He would make a catch and they would eat. Their life was simple and quiet.

One day, the man felt a tug on his line. He pulled and pulled. Up came a big fish! But this was not just any fish. It could talk! "Please, let me go!" said the fish. "I am a magic fish. I can grant a wish!"
The man was kind. "I do not need a wish," he said. "You may go." He let the fish swim away. Waves splashed as it dove back into the sea. The man went home. He told his wife the story.
"What?" cried his wife. "You let it go? You did not make a wish?" "We are fine," said the man. "We have all we need." "Go back!" said his wife. "Ask for a nice home. This hut is too small!"
The man went back to the sea. He called: **"Fish, fish, in the sea, My wife made a wish for me!"** The fish came up from the waves. "What does she wish?" asked the fish. "A nice home," said the man.
"Go back. You will see," said the fish. The man went home. The little hut was gone! In its place stood a fine home with a gate and a path. His wife was happy. For a while.

But soon, the wife wanted more. "Go back to the fish!" she said. "Ask for a palace! I want to be queen!" The man did not want to. But he went to the sea. He called: **"Fish, fish, in the sea, My wife made a wish for me!"**

The fish came up. "What does she wish now?" "She wants to be queen," said the man. "She wants a palace." "Go back. You will see," said the fish. The man went home. A huge palace stood in place of the home! His wife wore a crown and sat on a throne.

But the wife still wanted more. "Go back!" she said. "I want to rule the sun and the moon! I want to tell them when to rise!" The man was sad. But he went to the sea one more time. Waves were tall and dark. The sky was gray. He called: **"Fish, fish, in the sea, My wife made a wish for me!"**

The fish came up. The water was wild. "What does she wish this time?" asked the fish. "She... she wants to rule the sun and the moon," the man said quietly. The fish was silent. Then it said, "Go back. You will see."

The man went home. The palace was gone! The fine home was gone! There was only the little hut, just as before. His wife sat inside. She had no crown. She had no throne. They were back where they started.

And that is where they stayed. The man went fishing each day. They ate what he caught. They had very little, just like before. But they learned a lesson: Be happy with what you have. Magic E Words (a_e, i_e) from the Story: made, make, wave, gate, place, palace, path, gave wife, life, fine, time, nine, five, rise Other Decodable Words: fish, wish, man, big, hut, sit, tug, swim, his, let, got, back, went, just "Fish, fish, in the sea, my wife made a wish for me!" 1. What did the man catch? (A magic fish!) 2. What was the first wish? (A nice home) 3. What was the second wish? (A palace, to be queen) 4. What was the last wish? (To rule the sun and the moon) 5. What happened at the end? (They went back to the little hut) 6. What is the lesson? (Be grateful for what you have; don't be greedy) - Magic E Hunt: Find all the magic e words. Circle the silent e! - Act It Out: Act out the man calling the fish. Use hand motions for waves! - Draw & Write: Draw the little hut, the nice home, and the palace. Which would you choose? - Billy's Connection: Billy the Goat is happy with his simple life on the mountain. He doesn't need a palace! Talk about what makes you happy. Theme: Gratitude and contentment. The wife wanted more and more, but greed made her lose everything. Be thankful for what you have!
